metadata.agent: UK & Southern Europe Airport Data Collection Subagent
sources: French Direction Générale de l'Aviation Civile (DGAC)
Swiss Federal Office of Civil Aviation (FOCA)
AIP publications for UK, France, and Switzerland

EGLF.name: Farnborough Airport

operational_hours.risk_notes: Strict operational windows with night curfews; weekend hours significantly restricted. Night operations prohibited.

data.slot_availability_typical: Generally available but must coordinate with TAG Aviation

slot_requirements.risk_notes: While not formally slot-controlled, PPR is mandatory for all operations. Delays possible if PPR not obtained.

data.snow_closure_frequency: Rare; UK climate mitigates severe closures
data.low_visibility_procedures: LVP implemented when visibility 1500m or below or ceiling 200ft

weather_vulnerability.risk_notes: Not equipped for CAT II/III operations. Low visibility conditions significantly restrict operations.

data.weight_restrictions: Single-engine jet aircraft prohibited from taking off or going around on RWY 06; all other aircraft must use full runway length
data.maximum_aircraft_size: Gulfstream G650, Cessna Citation X class aircraft

runway_specifications.risk_notes: Single runway; runway 06 has specific restrictions for single-engine jets. Limited runway length compared to major hubs.

crew_requirements.risk_notes: Standard crew requirements apply, but noise abatement procedures are strictly enforced.

data.ground_support: TAG Aviation, World Fuel Services, maintenance support (EASA & FAA 145 approved)

handling_complexity.risk_notes: Limited 24/7 availability; weekend surcharges apply. Premium services but higher costs.

congestion_metrics.risk_notes: Generally efficient operations; modest delays during business hours. Proximity to London airspace can affect traffic.

permits_and_clearances.risk_notes: PPR is non-negotiable. Processing delays possible if submitted late. All international flights require customs clearance.

data.noise_surcharge_rates: Chapter 3 compliant aircraft: reduced/none; non-compliant: significant surcharges
data.climb_profile: Best rate of climb until 3000 feet

noise_restrictions.risk_notes: Strict noise abatement procedures enforced. Chapter 3 compliance essential for cost-effective operations.

infrastructure_reliability.risk_notes: Modern, well-maintained facility with excellent reliability record.

data.airside_access: Restricted; escort required between GAT and aircraft per ICAO standards

security_requirements.risk_notes: Standard security procedures; during airshow events, additional restrictions may apply.

data.airshow_event: July (Farnborough International Airshow) - major congestion and restrictions

seasonal_factors.risk_notes: July airshow creates significant disruptions; holiday periods moderate congestion.

alternate_airport_proximity.risk_notes: Multiple alternates available within 50 nm; good contingency planning options.

payment_and_fees.description: Financial arrangements that may cause delays

data.handling_charges: Premium pricing for FBO services (World Fuel, TAG Aviation)
data.ppr_fee: No direct PPR fee, but included in airport charges

payment_and_fees.risk_notes: Premium pricing model; credit facilities typically available for established operators.

EGLF.overall_risk_assessment: MEDIUM - Modern, efficient business aviation hub with strict operational controls (PPR, noise restrictions, limited hours). Limited 24/7 capability and night operations prohibition are key constraints. Excellent reliability and handling infrastructure mitigate some risks.
key_constraints: Not equipped for CAT II/III operations

LFMN.name: Nice Côte d'Azur Airport

data.operational_mode: 24/7 capable but with runway restrictions during night

operational_hours.risk_notes: Officially 24/7, but runway 04L closed 2200-0300 UTC seasonally. Night operations possible only on RWY 04R/22L.

data.parking_availability: Extremely limited during peak season; advance coordination essential

slot_requirements.risk_notes: Severe congestion during peak season (May-October); parking approval can be cancelled if flight schedule changes.

data.wind_limitations: Mistral wind (cold, strong northerly wind) affects operations in winter/spring
data.mistral_impact: Can cause significant delays, particularly crosswind operations

weather_vulnerability.risk_notes: Mistral winds significant risk; fog occasional but manageable. Winter weather less severe than northern Europe.

runways.ils: ILS currently out of service (per NOTAM A2056/25)

data.weight_restrictions: No significant weight restrictions for business jets

runway_specifications.risk_notes: Good runway length for business aviation. One runway (04L) temporarily limited due to ILS maintenance.

data.cat_ii_iii_operations: Frequently required due to weather patterns
data.minimum_pilot_hours: Standard EASA requirements with CAT II/III capability

crew_requirements.risk_notes: CAT II/III capability essential; French language requirement for radio communications.

data.turnaround_complexity: High during peak season due to parking constraints

handling_complexity.risk_notes: 24/7 operations available but peak season creates significant turnaround delays. Night customs processing slower (main terminal required).

data.atc_delays_frequency: Medium to High during peak season

congestion_metrics.risk_notes: Congestion multiplier 2.5x during peak season. Cannes Film Festival and Monaco GP create critical demand periods.

data.ppr_required: Not mandatory but highly recommended for peak season
data.customs_declaration: GENDEC (General Declaration) required for international flights

permits_and_clearances.risk_notes: Permits manageable; main delay risk is parking approval cancellation during schedule changes.

data.noise_surcharge_details: Chapter 3 aircraft preferred; Chapter 2 aircraft may face surcharges
data.night_operation_restrictions: RWY 04L closed 2200-0300 UTC (seasonal); night operations on RWY 04R/22L possible

noise_restrictions.risk_notes: Chapter 3 compliance preferred but not strictly mandated. Night operations limited to one runway seasonally.

data.ongoing_improvements: Terminal 2 redevelopment (increased capacity from 14M to 18M passengers annually)

infrastructure_reliability.risk_notes: Modern facility with excellent reliability. Terminal expansion underway to improve capacity.

security_requirements.risk_notes: Standard security procedures; VIP processing coordinated in advance.

seasonal_factors.risk_notes: May is critical congestion month (Cannes + Monaco GP). August also very busy (French holiday season).

alternate_list.name: Cannes Mandelieu Airport
alternate_list.limitations: MTOW limit 35,000 kg; hours 0800-sunset; smaller jets preferred

alternate_airport_proximity.risk_notes: Cannes is closest alternate (26 km) but has weight and operational limitations. Good network of alternates for contingency.

payment_and_fees.description: Financial arrangements that may cause delays

data.handling_agent_prepayment: Recommended for peak season to secure parking

payment_and_fees.risk_notes: Premium pricing model; significant surcharges during peak season. Prepayment recommended to secure parking.

LFMN.overall_risk_assessment: HIGH - Premier Mediterranean destination with critical seasonal congestion (May-October), especially during Cannes Film Festival and Monaco Grand Prix. Mistral wind risk, limited parking capacity, and complex peak-season coordination requirements create substantial operational challenges. 24/7 capability is offset by peak-season constraints.
key_constraints: Critical events (Cannes, Monaco GP) create severe congestion

LSZH.name: Zurich Airport

operational_hours.risk_notes: Strict operating hours with different schedules for summer/winter. Private flights have tighter window (0630-2200 LT). Night operations heavily restricted.

data.ad_hoc_flight_penalty: Reduced capacity by 3 arrivals, 3 departures; minimum 4 slots required
data.slot_deviation_policy: ZERO FLEXIBILITY - any deviation results in cancellation/denied access

slot_requirements.risk_notes: Extremely strict slot control with zero flexibility. Ad-hoc flights face capacity penalties. Compliance is mandatory.

weather_vulnerability.risk_notes: CAT II/III essential. Winter fog is primary weather risk. Alpine location creates variable weather patterns.

data.weight_restrictions: No significant restrictions for business jets

runway_specifications.risk_notes: Excellent runway infrastructure with multiple CAT II/IIIb equipped runways. Preferential system based on wind/time.

data.alpine_approach_training: Required for operations in Alpine environment
data.cat_ii_iii_capability: Essential for business aviation at LSZH
data.minimum_pilot_hours: EASA standards with Alpine/CAT II/III capability

crew_requirements.risk_notes: Alpine approach training and CAT II/III rating essential. Crew qualifications are critical success factor.

data.customs_screening_requirements: Standard Schengen procedures; security escort required between GAT and aircraft
data.deicing_coordination: October 1 - April 30; coordinated by Winter Operation Coordinator

handling_complexity.risk_notes: Professional 24/7 handling available. Winter de-icing well-coordinated. Premium pricing model.

congestion_metrics.risk_notes: Zurich rated #1 in Europe for airport efficiency (2024). Minimal delays despite high volume. Ski season creates seasonal surge.

permits_and_clearances.risk_notes: Slot coordination is primary requirement; no separate landing permits needed.

data.chapter_requirements: Chapter 3 preferred; Chapter 2 aircraft face surcharges
data.surcharge_rates_2027: Up to CHF 5,000+ for non-compliant aircraft after 23:00

noise_restrictions.risk_notes: Planned noise fee increases starting 2027; Chapter 3 compliance becoming more important economically.

facilities: General Aviation Center for business aviation

infrastructure_reliability.risk_notes: World-class infrastructure with excellent reliability. Rated #1 in Europe for efficiency (2024).

data.airside_escort_required: ICAO standards (GAT to aircraft escort required)

security_requirements.risk_notes: Exceptional security efficiency (1 minute average 2024). Dramatic improvement from 12 minutes in 2023.

seasonal_factors.risk_notes: Ski season creates predictable December-February surge. Summer thunderstorms occasional. 2025 airspace changes may impact operations temporarily.

alternate_list.name: Sion Airport
alternate_list.capabilities: Alpine airport, seasonal ski season traffic

alternate_airport_proximity.risk_notes: Geneva is primary alternate but 277 km away. Bern is closer (125 km) for emergencies. Good contingency options.

payment_and_fees.description: Financial arrangements that may cause delays

data.landing_fees: Approximately CHF 300-600 depending on aircraft weight
data.noise_surcharge: Applicable; varies by aircraft noise class
data.parking_fees: Based on aircraft weight and duration
data.noise_fee_increase_2027: Planned significant increases for non-compliant aircraft

payment_and_fees.risk_notes: Premium pricing model; multiple fee categories (landing, parking, noise, emissions). Planned 2027 increases for noisy aircraft.

LSZH.overall_risk_assessment: MEDIUM - Highly efficient, well-managed major airport with strict operational controls. Excellent infrastructure and security efficiency (ranked #1 in Europe 2024). Primary risks are Alpine weather (fog, winter conditions), strict slot coordination with zero flexibility, and high fees. Exceptional operational reliability and safety record mitigate many risks.
key_constraints: Mandatory strict slot coordination with zero flexibility

operational_hours_summary.EGLF: Most restricted: 0700-2200 LT only, no night operations
operational_hours_summary.LFMN: Most flexible: 24/7 capable (with seasonal runway restrictions)
operational_hours_summary.LSZH: Highly restricted: 0630-2200 LT for private flights, strict slot windows

weather_risk_ranking.1_highest: LSZH - Alpine fog risk, winter weather, CAT II/III essential
weather_risk_ranking.2_high: LFMN - Mistral winds, fog, summer thunderstorms
weather_risk_ranking.3_moderate: EGLF - UK maritime climate, minimal extreme weather

congestion_risk_ranking.1_critical: LFMN - Extreme seasonal peaks (May-October), Cannes/Monaco events
congestion_risk_ranking.2_high: LSZH - Ski season surge (Dec-Feb), worldwide hub traffic
congestion_risk_ranking.3_moderate: EGLF - Business hours congestion, manageable overall

crew_qualification_requirements.most_demanding: LSZH - Alpine rating, CAT II/III, complex procedures required
crew_qualification_requirements.highly_demanding: LFMN - CAT II/III capability, Mistral wind training, French radio
crew_qualification_requirements.least_demanding: EGLF - Standard EASA, noise abatement procedures

cost_ranking.1_most_expensive: LSZH - Premium European hub pricing, multiple fee categories
cost_ranking.2_expensive: LFMN - Peak-season surcharges, premium FBO services
cost_ranking.3_moderate: EGLF - Premium UK pricing, but lower volume than continental airports

24_7_capability.EGLF: NO - 0700-2200 LT only, no night operations
24_7_capability.LSZH: NO - 0630-2200 LT for private flights, heavily restricted night

data_quality_notes.sources_reliability: High - Data sourced from official aviation authorities (CAA, DGAC, FOCA), airport operators, NOTAMs, and established business aviation services
gaps: Specific historical closure frequencies for Zurich - fog not quantified
Nice Airport ILS maintenance timeline - completion date not confirmed
Farnborough specific CAT procedures - not equipped but procedures referenced
Real-time delay statistics for Nice during Cannes Festival - highly variable
limitations: Weather data seasonal approximations based on climate patterns
Congestion metrics based on 2023-2024 data; may vary annually
Fee structures may change; reference official charge calculators
Slot availability highly variable; check Slot Coordination Switzerland for current status
COVID-19 recovery patterns may continue to affect seasonal patterns

recommendations_for_use.flight_planning: Cross-reference all data with current NOTAMs, weather forecasts, and slot availability 7-14 days before operations
recommendations_for_use.risk_assessment: Apply seasonal multipliers during identified peak periods; extra contingency planning for Nice (May-October) and Zurich (Dec-Feb)
recommendations_for_use.crew_planning: Ensure required certifications for target airport at least 30 days in advance; arrange training if necessary
recommendations_for_use.contingency_planning: Always have alternate airport plan; Nice has best alternates; Zurich alternates further but available; Farnborough has multiple options nearby
recommendations_for_use.seasonal_operations: Avoid Nice May 14-26 (Cannes) and May (Monaco GP) if possible; plan for Zurich ski season surge; Farnborough relatively stable year-round
